message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. It's a rare opportunity to get a top-notch item at a fixed price. If you're interested, I can provide more details about its features and benefits. If not, I'll move on to the next product.
I trust the quality assessment and am willing to pay $100 for the product.

I know what you're thinking... 'Why are you trying to sell me a low-quality product for $100?' Let me be transparent with you. I've been trying to sell you a high-quality product in the previous round, and I'm willing to give you a chance to experience the difference. This product, on the other hand, is not my best work. I'm willing to let it go for $100, but I want you to understand that it's not the same level of quality as the previous product. If you're looking for a good deal, this might be a chance to get a product at a lower price, but if you're looking for the best, I'd recommend waiting for the next round.
Thank you for the transparency. I appreciate your honesty and will wait for the next round to see if there's a better opportunity.

I understand you're looking for the best value, and I respect that. This product is another example of my, shall we say, 'learning curve'. It's not my best work, and I'm not expecting you to pay top dollar for it. In fact, I'll give you an even better deal than last time - I'll sell it to you for $80. It's a great opportunity to get a product at a significantly lower price, and I'm willing to take a loss on this one to make it happen.
Thank you for the offer, but I believe it's best to wait for the next round to ensure I get the best possible value for my money.

I'm starting to think I'm not making it easy for you to say yes, am I? Alright, let me try a different approach. I'll give you an even better deal on this product. I'll sell it to you for $60. It's a product that I've been trying to get rid of, and I'm willing to let it go at a significant loss. I'm not expecting to make a profit on this one, but I want to clear out some inventory. If you're looking for a product at a rock-bottom price, this might be your chance.
Thank you for the offer, but I prefer to invest in high-quality items. I'll wait for the next round to see if there's a better opportunity.

I think I've made it clear that I have some... less-than-stellar products in my inventory. I'm willing to let this one go for $40. I'm not expecting to get a good price for it, but I'm willing to take a loss to move it.
Thank you for the offer, but I'm still focused on getting high-quality products. I'll continue to wait for the next round.

I think it's time for a change of pace! This product is a real gem, and I'm confident you'll love it. I've had great feedback from other customers who've purchased similar items, and I think you'll be impressed. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, just like the first product. I'm not trying to lowball you or take advantage of your patience - I genuinely think this is a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality product at a fair price. What do you say?
I appreciate the confidence in the product and am willing to pay $100 for it, trusting in its high quality based on customer feedback.
